episodes.title: Two
episodes.plot: Two survivors of an apocalyptic battle, a man and a woman from each opposing sides, approach each other suspiciously.

episodes.title: The Arrival
episodes.plot: Federal aviation investigator Grant Sheckly must deal with a mystery when a plane lands at an airport without pilots, passengers or luggage.

episodes.title: The Shelter
episodes.plot: A suburban dinner party is interrupted by a bulletin warning of an impending nuclear attack. As the neighbors scramble to prepare themselves, they turn against the one family that installed a permanent bomb shelter.

episodes.title: The Passersby
episodes.plot: While headed home, a Confederate soldier meets an anguished woman at the end of the Civil War.

episodes.title: A Game of Pool
episodes.plot: A frustrated pool champ has beaten everyone. Everyone except one man; the legend, Fats Brown. Brown is dead, and the champ can only curse his name. But guess who just walked in.

episodes.title: The Mirror
episodes.plot: A Central American revolutionary comes into the possession of a mirror that shows him his potential assassins.

episodes.title: The Grave
episodes.plot: Old West lawman Conny Miller visits the grave of a man who he failed to track down to prove he was never afraid of him but gets more than he bargained for.

episodes.title: It's a Good Life
episodes.plot: On an isolated family farm, a young boy with vast mental powers, but lacking emotional development, holds his terrified family in thrall to his every juvenile wish.

episodes.title: Deaths-Head Revisited
episodes.plot: A former German SS captain returns to Dachau concentration camp and begins reminiscing on the power he enjoyed there, until he finds himself on trial by those who died at his hands.

episodes.title: The Midnight Sun
episodes.plot: When the Earth falls out of orbit, two women try to cope with increasingly oppressive heat in a nearly abandoned city.

episodes.title: Still Valley
episodes.plot: In June 1863, Confederate soldiers come across a warlock who can help bring victory to the Southern cause.

episodes.title: The Jungle
episodes.plot: A businessman who has recently returned from Africa is stalked by the superstitions and warnings of a witch doctor.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Time
episodes.plot: Janitor Woodrow Mulligan gets a trip from 1890 to 1962 courtesy of his employer's time helmet.

episodes.title: Five Characters in Search of an Exit
episodes.plot: An Army major awakens in a small room with no idea of who he is or how he got there. He finds four other people in the same room, and they all begin to question how they each arrived there, and more importantly, how to escape.

episodes.title: A Quality of Mercy
episodes.plot: Hot-shot new Lieutenant Katell tries to make his mark on the last day of World War II in the Pacific and gets a unique perspective on his actions.

episodes.title: Nothing in the Dark
episodes.plot: An old woman has fought with death a thousand times and has always won. But now she finds herself afraid to let a wounded policeman in her door for fear he is Mr. Death. Is he?

episodes.title: One More Pallbearer
episodes.plot: Wealthy Paul Radin tries to get three people from his past to apologize to him by offering them shelter from a staged and phony nuclear war scenario.

episodes.title: Dead Man's Shoes
episodes.plot: A homeless man takes the shoes off a dead gangster and steps into his life.

episodes.title: The Hunt
episodes.plot: Upon returning from a coon hunt, Hyder Simpson discovers that no one can see or hear him because he has passed on.

episodes.title: Showdown with Rance McGrew
episodes.plot: The star of a Western TV series suddenly finds himself transported back in time to the real Wild West, and face-to-face with the real Jesse James.

episodes.title: Kick the Can
episodes.plot: An old man living in a rest home thinks he's found the secret of youth in children's games.

episodes.title: A Piano in the House
episodes.plot: Sadistic and hated theater critic Fitzgerald Fortune buys a player piano that has the power to reveal the souls of all who hear it.

episodes.title: The Last Rites of Jeff Myrtlebank
episodes.plot: A young man wakes up at his own funeral and wants to know what the heck is going on. The townfolk are glad to see him back, but they begin to wonder if he's a man.. or something else?

episodes.title: To Serve Man
episodes.plot: An alien race comes to Earth, promising peace and sharing technology. A linguist and his team set out to translate the aliens' language, using a book whose title they deduce is "To Serve Man."

episodes.title: The Fugitive
episodes.plot: Jenny and the other kids don't realize that the kindly yet magical old duffer they play with in the park is really an intergalactic fugitive hiding out till two serious men come looking for him, asking questions that test their friendship.

episodes.title: Little Girl Lost
episodes.plot: Awakened in the middle of the night by the cries of his daughter, a father enters the girl's room to find that she has vanished - even though he can still hear her crying out for help.

episodes.title: Person or Persons Unknown
episodes.plot: David Gurney wakes up to another ordinary day. Except today, nobody knows who he is.

episodes.title: The Little People
episodes.plot: On a desolate planet, two astronauts discover an entire society populated by incredibly small beings. One of the astronauts decides to rule the society as a god.

episodes.title: Four O'Clock
episodes.plot: A very obsessed man wants to expose evil in the world, investigating people he sees as murderers, subversives, perverts and communists, then attempting to ruin their lives.

episodes.title: Hocus-Pocus and Frisby
episodes.plot: A rural gas station attendant given to telling tall tales about himself is kidnapped by aliens who believe him to be one of Earth's leading intellects.

episodes.title: The Trade-Ins
episodes.plot: An elderly couple shop for younger replacement bodies, then resort to desperate measures to cover the cost.

episodes.title: The Gift
episodes.plot: A man from the stars comes with a gift to a small Mexican village whose residents do not welcome this stranger.

episodes.title: The Dummy
episodes.plot: Ventriloquist Jerry Etherson is convinced that his dummy, Willie, is alive and evil. He locks Willie in a trunk and makes plans for a new act with a new dummy. Too bad he didn't clear those plans with Willie first.

episodes.title: Young Man's Fancy
episodes.plot: Newlywed Alex Walker finds himself being pulled back to his childhood and back to his widowed mother in the house where he grew up.

episodes.title: I Sing the Body Electric
episodes.plot: A recent widower, needing loving care for his three young children, orders a cybernetic "grandmother". While two of the children accept her, one of his daughters fiercely rejects her, with near tragic consequences.

episodes.title: Cavender Is Coming
episodes.plot: Inept guardian angel Harmon Cavender is given a chance to earn his wings by helping an unconventional big city woman, the young, awkward Agnes Grep.

episodes.title: The Changing of the Guard
episodes.plot: After being forced to retire, Professor Fowler contemplates suicide when he doesn't feel he's made a difference in the world.
